title: Iran Bets Its Economy Will Hold as It Takes Tough Stance on Nuclear Program
sub_head: Negotiators are in Vienna this week to find a breakthrough in stalled talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal
body:
TEHRAN—U.S. sanctions on Iran have battered the country’s economy, causing unemployment to soar and its currency to plummet, which has helped stoke public unrest in recent years.
Still, Iranian officials say the country’s economy is resilient and would survive even if talks collapse with the U.S. and other world powers to revive the 2015 nuclear deal and grant Iran sanctions relief.
